meanings.definition: A spot resembling an eye, as on the wings of some butterflies.
meanings.sent1: The butterfly's wings had beautiful eyespots that helped scare away predators.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the eyespots on the butterfly's wings as it fluttered by.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the eyespots on the butterfly were real eyes watching him.
meanings.sent4: The eyespots on the wings seemed to follow her every move, like tiny guardians.
meanings.sent5: The eyespots on the wings were so vivid, they almost looked like real eyes staring back.

meanings.definition: A small, round, colored spot on the skin, as in certain diseases.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the patient's skin and noticed a strange eyespot on their arm.
meanings.sent2: The eyespot on her cheek was a unique feature that made her stand out.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the eyespot on his nose was a secret superpower waiting to be activated.
meanings.sent4: The eyespot on her hand seemed to glow, drawing everyone's attention to it.
meanings.sent5: The eyespot on his forehead was so bright, it almost looked like a tiny gem embedded in his skin.
